sentences: Benoît Moerlen (born 6 February 1956) is a French percussionist, best known for his work in Gong, Pierre Moerlen's Gong and a later offshoot Gongzilla.
Moerlen first played with Gong on 1974's You, Pierre already being a member.
He joined more permanently for Gazeuse! (1976) and Expresso II (1978) when the band had come under Pierre's leadership.
He joined more permanently for Gazeuse! (1976) and Expresso II (1978) when the band had come under Pierre's leadership.
Benoît remained with the band for Downwind (1979) and Live (released 1980).
Benoît remained with the band for Downwind (1979) and Live (released 1980).
Having left in 1979, Benoît joined Pierre in Mike Oldfield's touring band, and he appears on the resultant live album Exposed (1979).
Having left in 1979, Benoît joined Pierre in Mike Oldfield's touring band, and he appears on the resultant live album Exposed (1979).
He re-joined Pierre Moerlen's Gong in the late 1980s for Second Wind and Full Circle Live '88, also playing additional keyboards.
He re-joined Pierre Moerlen's Gong in the late 1980s for Second Wind and Full Circle Live '88, also playing additional keyboards.
He also appeared with Pierre on Oldfield's Islands (1987).
They released Suffer (1995) and Thrive (1996, with guests David Torn and Gary Husband).
They released Suffer (1995) and Thrive (1996, with guests David Torn and Gary Husband).
In 2005, Benoît was rehearsing with Pierre for a new line-up of Pierre Moerlen's Gong when Pierre died in his sleep.
